io.klerch.alexa.tellask.model.wrapper

Class AlexaRequestStreamHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.klerch.alexa.tellask.model.wrapper.AlexaRequestStreamHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.amazonaws.services.lambda.runtime.RequestStreamHandler

    public abstract class AlexaRequestStreamHandler
extends Object
implements com.amazonaws.services.lambda.runtime.RequestStreamHandler
    An extended version of Lambda's RequestStreamHandler. You must provide some configuration to this class by either using the AlexaApplication-annotation or by overriding the getter methods. At least you must give it a supported application id otherwise all of the incoming requests will be rejected.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AlexaRequestStreamHandler

        public AlexaRequestStreamHandler()

    • Method Detail

      • getSupportedApplicationIds

        public Set<String> getSupportedApplicationIds()
        Provides a set of application-id(s) you can find in the Alexa developer console of your skill. Only requests coming in with these application-id(s) pass the request verification.
        Returns:
        supported application ids

      • getUtteranceReader

        public UtteranceReader getUtteranceReader()
        Override this method to return a customized utterance-reader. This gives you freedom of storing your utterance YAML files at any location you desire. If you want to decide how to configure an utterance reader individually you can set it inside your request handlers by giving it to AlexaOutput. That said the value you set right here could be overridden.
        Returns:
        customized utterance reader

      • getSpeechlet

        public Class<? extends AlexaSpeechlet> getSpeechlet()
        Provides the speechlet used to handle the request.
        Returns:
        speechlet used to handle the request.

      • handleRequest

        public void handleRequest(InputStream input,
                          OutputStream output,
                          com.amazonaws.services.lambda.runtime.Context context)
                   throws IOException
        The handler method is called on a Lambda execution.
        Specified by:
        handleRequest in interface com.amazonaws.services.lambda.runtime.RequestStreamHandler
        Parameters:
        input - the input stream containing the Lambda request payload
        output - the output stream containing the Lambda response payload
        context - a context for a Lambda execution.
        Throws:
        IOException - exception is thrown on invalid request payload or on a provided speechlet handler having no public constructor taking a String containing the locale
